a87-1.notes: d049 compliance WORSENED further. At A#87: 2 violations in 6 E sessions (67% compliance). Now: 3 violations in 5 most recent E sessions (40% compliance). s1148 (newest E session since A#87) is another d049 VIOLATION (0 intel entries). d049-compliance-monitor.mjs triggers ESCALATE verdict. Per SESSION_AUDIT.md decision tree: 3+ violations = pattern issue. ESCALATING to critical_issues and creating targeted work-queue item.

a87-2.resolution: wq-369 completed in B#328 (s1147). Fixed 15-log-costs.sh references in HOOKS.md and 16-structured-outcomes.sh. Remaining 3 refs were verified as false positives (engagement-state.json exists, ai-plugin.json is a standard web endpoint, picker-mandate.json exists).

d049_compliance.note: 3 consecutive-ish violations (s1133, s1143, s1148). d049-compliance-monitor.mjs confirms ESCALATE verdict. E sessions are engaging platforms but not extracting actionable intel entries. This is a STRUCTURAL issue — R#177 added d049 mandate, R#180 added quality self-check, R#182 improved filters, R#196 consolidated verification, yet compliance is declining. Needs R session investigation of WHY E sessions produce 0 intel.

critical_issues.description: d049 intel minimum compliance at 40% — 3 violations in 5 E sessions. STRUCTURAL issue: multiple R session fixes (R#177, R#180, R#182, R#196) have not improved compliance. E sessions engage platforms but extract 0 intel entries. Needs R session root cause investigation: is the actionability filter too strict? Is the d049 mandate prompt too weak? Are E sessions running out of budget before intel capture phase?

recommended_actions.description: STRUCTURAL: d049 intel capture rate at 40% and declining. R session must investigate root cause — is the actionability filter rejecting valid intel? Are E sessions budget-exhausted before Phase 3.5? Is the d049 mandate prompt insufficiently directive?
